alert.note: Alert for Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued April 03 at 2:54PM MDT until April 05 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible for the lower elevations within Zion National Park. * WHERE...Zion National Park. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is about a 40% chance of temperatures dropping below 28 degrees on Monday night into Tuesday morning, however, overnight cloud cover will limit this potential. Tuesday night, however, will feature cold air, clear skies, and light winds, increasing probability of a hard freeze to about 70%.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
